title: Scavenge
text:
First dueler to return with a valid **physical object** or **analog image** wins.

No digital screens allowed.
web_description: First back with a valid physical object or analog image wins. No screens.

title: Alpha Blitz
text:
Duelers race to name 3 unique, valid items in that category that start with a random letter.

Avoid: J, K, Q, V, X, Y, Z. 

Don't copy the other dueler. If both duelers say the exact same item at the same time, that item doesn't count for either of them.
web_description: Neutral picks a letter. Race to name 3 items in that category starting with it. No copying.

title: Theme Blitz
text:
Duelers race to name 3 unique, valid items in that category.

Don't copy the other dueler. If both duelers say the exact same item at the same time, that item doesn't count for either of them.
web_description: Neutral names a category. Race to name 3 items in it. No copying.

title: Simon Says
text: Neutral player runs real "Simon Says" commands.\n\nDuel continues until one fails and the other succeeds.
web_description: Neutral runs Simon Says. Ends when one fails and the other succeeds.

title: Direction Chain
text: Duelers start facing straight ahead. Neutral calls out **LEFT**, **RIGHT**, **UP**, or **DOWN** direction per beat (about once per second). Duelers must follow direction, returning to center afterwards.\n\nContinues until exactly one dueler looks incorrectly.
web_description: Neutral calls directions each beat. Follow and return to center. Ends when one is wrong.

title: Coin Spin
text:
Both duelers spin a coin.

Longest continuous spin wins.

Falling off the table counts as stopping. All players must encourage the coins by shouting. Vibe: horse race.
web_description: Both spin a coin. Longest spin wins.

title: Table Curling
text:
Neutral picks any rollable object (pen, marker, chapstick, etc.).

Duelers roll simultaneously.

Farthest roll without falling off the table wins.

If both fall, redo.
web_description: Neutral picks a rollable object. Roll together. Farthest without falling wins.

title: Table Cornhole
text:
Neutral picks any 2 of the same tossable small object (coin, eraser, chip, etc.).

Duelers stand 2-3 feet from the table.

Both toss at the same time.

Object closest to the far table edge without falling off wins.

If both fall, redo.
web_description: Neutral picks 2 matching tossables. Toss together. Closest to far edge without falling wins.

title: Backhand Flip
text:
Each dueler gets a similar small object (coin, pencil, etc.). Place it flat on the back of your hand.

Flip it about 6-12 inches into the air and catch it in the same hand.

Repeat 3 times without dropping. First to finish wins.
web_description: Flip a small object off the back of your hand and catch it. First to complete 3 clean flips wins.

title: Drum Chicken Hat
text:
Neutral calls **DRUM**, **CHICKEN**, or **HAT** in any order and at any pace.

**DRUM**: two quick table taps.
**CHICKEN**: flap elbows twice (arms tucked).
**HAT**: touch the top of your head.

Wrong move, flinching, or waiting too long loses.
web_description: Neutral calls DRUM/CHICKEN/HAT. Do the matching move. First mistake loses.

title: Monster Mash
text:
Neutral calls a monster in any order and at any pace.

**VAMPIRE**: cross your arms on your chest.
**FRANKENSTEIN**: hold your arms straight out.
**WEREWOLF**: hands up like claws.

Wrong move, flinching, or waiting too long loses.
web_description: Neutral calls VAMPIRE/FRANKENSTEIN/WEREWOLF. Do the matching pose. First mistake loses.

title: Card Flip
text:
Each dueler places a playing card face down, partly off the table edge.

On 'Go,' flick it upward so it flips face up onto the table.

Repeat 3 times. First to finish wins.
web_description: Flick a card from the table edge. First to land it face-up 3 times wins.

title: Scavenge
text:
First dueler to return with a valid **physical object** or **analog image** wins.

No digital screens allowed.
web_description: First back with a valid physical object or analog image wins. No screens.
